title: Rispondi a tutti
content:
Buongiorno

Uso Thunderbird 102.10.1 installato su Mac Os. Con alcuni indirizzi quando utilizzo la funzione rispondi a tutti, mi crea una doppia mail del campo destinatario ma il primo me lo da errato, rosso, come si può vedere in foto ed il secondo corretto. Devo ogni volta manualmente cancellare quello rosso e la mail parte senza problemi. Grazie a chi tenterà di aiutarmi.

Alessandro
creator: user64446019264410496905781563938968738243

title: Incoming Folder Already Exists
content: Hi, I have had Thunderbirds for over 7 years seamlesly downloading emails from 2 email accounts. One with Google and the other with Talk Talk. I have recently purchased a new PC and have downloaded Thunderbirds onto it. I have had no problems in sync the email account with Google. In seeking to synch the account with my Talk Talk email, I get the following message- "Incoming Folder Already exists" I have deleted the old Thunderbirds from my old PC I have deleted Thunderbirds on the new PC. Shut it down and then downloaded it once more Again, the Google sync was easy and successful in seconds The synch to my Talk Talk email account brings up the message "Incoming Folder Already exists". I am thus prevented from downloading messages to and from that email account, which is the one I principally use. Some help please to a doddering quasi septagenarian
creator: nicastro6

title: Thunderbird
content: When trying to print, after hitting print, I see a "preview" and a right hand box with details about the printing. However, I'm sometimes unable to scroll down the right and side to the "print" button. I don't have this problem when trying to print an e-mail directly, but do experience it at other times. For example, when trying to print a form I have filled out that was sent in an e-mail (usually in Chrome)>
creator: knownothin

title: Black window if TB is autostarted in Raspberry Pi OS
content:
Using a Raspberry Pi 4 to automatically send emails while away, and I want to make sure Thunderbird starts if there is a power failure, so that the Send Later add-on will work.

I seem to have the same issue as this user on Debian, only I'm using Raspberry Pi OS on a RPi4.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1401261

Thunderbird starts normally when I start it from either the desktop icon or the command line. But no matter which autostart method I try, it always opens with a black window. I suspect something with the X11 windowing system?

Here are the methods I've tried, all with the same result.

1. Creating a file /home/sgilson99/pi/.config/autostart/startthunderbird.desktop

Which contains the following, basically the same as the desktop icon file thunderbird.desktop:

[Desktop Entry] Encoding=UTF-8 Type=Application Name=startthunderbird.desktop Comment= Exec= thunderbird StartupNotify=false Terminal=false Hidden=false

2. Placing an exact copy of the desktop icon file thunderbird.desktop into the following folder:

/etc/xdg/autostart

3. Adding the last line to the file /etc/xdg/lxsession/LXDE-pi/autostart

@lxpanel --profile LXDE @pcmanfm --desktop --profile LXDE @xscreensaver -no-splash @thunderbird

(and tried various thunderbird command line options here to specify the user profile) (and tried sleep up to 60 seconds before the last line) (and tried replacing the @thunderbird line with a call to a shell script that starts Thunderbird

So, it appears to be the same issue the above referenced user is having on Debian, so I'm sure they could benefit from a solution.

Super weird!

Any help would be appreciated! Thanks, Scott
creator: scott180

title: macOS Thunderbird 102.10.1
content:
Running macOS 13.3.1

Just upgrade to Thunderbird 102.10.1 from Thunderbird 102.10.0 TB will now only part open - keeps getting stuck. I have a couple of 365 accounts in it. Downloaded Thunderbird 102.10.0 and copied over to try and revert but still the same issue.

Folder pane opens but not preview pane and then it locks up - have to force quit.

Any ideas? thanks Carl
creator: PindarCreative

title: My Thunderbird "Portable" opening panel contains no information
content:
Today When I started my "C:\_PortableApps.com\Thunderbird Portable"\ThunderbirdPortable.exe" My Thunderbird "Portable" opening panel contains no information. The only thing I could see was if I clicked on "Account Settings" Tab. The only way I could Fix it was Closing Thunderbird and renaming "C:\_PortableApps.com\Thunderbird "\ to C:\_PortableApps.com\Thunderbird Portable" to "C:\_PortableApps.com\Thunderbird Portable-Broke" and the Start "C:\_PortableApps.com\Thunderbird Portable-Broke\ThunderbirdPortable.exe"

I even Deleted My "C:\Users\Admin\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profile" Folder and reinstalled "ThunderbirdPortable_102.10.0_English.paf.exe".

I think somewhere on local computer something is "Referencing" The "C:\_PortableApps.com\Thunderbird Portable" Folder it won't let my Opening Page show anything.

If I copy "C:\_PortableApps.com\Thunderbird Portable-Broke" and Rename it "C:\_PortableApps.com\Thunderbird Portable" Folder it won't let my Opening Page show anything, But If I start "C:\_PortableApps.com\Thunderbird Portable\\ThunderbirdPortable.exe" I can see my Opening Page.

I can't remember if I added any files to "My Local Folders" In most of my Setups on other computers with different email addresses I usually do and I can't remember If I did on this computer for sure.
creator: davidekreifels

title: Sorting emails by received not sent
content:
Hi,

I use Thunderbird (version 102.10 as of now) with the DAVMAIL utility (version 6.1.0-3423 https://sourceforge.net/projects/davmail/ ) for my Office 365 email account. It seems that recently (last month or so?) I have the issue that when someone uses Outlook's delayed-send option to send me an email, it shows up in my Thunderbird INBOX by the sent date, not the received date. I tried changing columns from "DATE" to "RECEIVED" but that did not fix the issue. Using "ORDER RECEIVED" is a little better, but seems to move other messages around in ways that don't make sense either.

Any help is much appreciated.

title: Thunderbird Suddenly Won't Send Emails
content:
Thunderbird 102.10.1 (32-bit) Windows 10

On Wednesday afternoon, a couple of hours after the last email I sent, Thunderbird suddenly started bouncing my emails, with an error message saying "The email server responded <my email address> sender rejected. The email address you are sending as must match the email address you used to auth." I haven't touched those settings since I installed Thunderbird on this PC back in 2019. I've been running Thunderbird as far back as I can recall, probably as long as it has existed.

Image 1, SceenShot-bounce.

I have two email addresses with this provider (Spectrum Internet) a main address and a much less heavily-used alternate. The alternate works. Their SMTP settings are identical.

Thinking it could be my ISP or it could be Thunderbird, I've tried several tests, up to changing my password at my ISP. Nothing has resolved it.

Image 2, Screenshot-bounce2-settings is the two accounts side by side.
creator: SiGraybeard

creator: robin78

title: Best method for mass uploading local emails to server?
content:
Hello

What would be the best method for uploading many local messages back to the server? I have about 9000 messages in my Thunderbird local inbox and about 3700 in my local sent folders that I'd like to re-upload back to the server. 6.5GB in total.

I've got an IMAP Outlook account (with an @live.com email address) with emails going back about 13 years. Previously, I used ImportExportTools NG to download all emails from 2010 - 2019 to my local folders and deleted them from the server to free up space. Recently we bought a 100GB cloud storage plan, so now I'd like to re-upload those old emails back to the server. What's the best method?

Everything I've read online says that trying to upload a lot of emails at once will cause errors, some messages will fail to upload but you might not know which ones, and other such issues. I'd like to avoid that headache so I haven't tried to upload a huge chunk yet.
creator: JABui

title: uploading folders
content:
We have AT&T. A few weeks ago, our email service went out and when it came back on, the POP3/SMTP server links weren't working. Found some guidance online that IMAP works better with ATT, so we deleted the account and created a new account with IMAP. Legacy folders and emails wouldn't show up. Found that TB had a new folder listed under IMAP, so migrated all my old folders into that new IMAP folder, but no matter what I do, they are not recognized, and Inbox will only load about 3 weeks of emails. Anyone know what the deal here is, or how I get TB to recognize my legacy folders?

The funny thing is, when I move them over and then restart, for an instant, they all show up, then a few seconds later, they disappear. This tells me that TB sees them in the folder, but then must overwrite them. Not sure how to stop that from happening? Do I need to actively create new folders on my list with the same name or something?
creator: harrington_1995

title: XML Parsing Error when opening Thunderbird
content:
Thunderbird will no longer open after years of reliable service. There appears to be a corrupted something somewhere. The full message is:

XML Parsing Error: not well-formed Location: chrome://messenger/content/messenger.xhtml Line Number 6683, Column 36: 

   <menuseparator id="spacesContex?￿on-1" </pre> 
^ 
I can select "Write New Message" by right clicking on the Thunderbird icon, and that works like a charm. However, if I click on "Open Address Book" by right clicking, I receive an identical message. 
My last backup was sadly about three months ago. 
Is there a cleaner somewhere which would identify and repair this errant character? 
Many thanks in advance for any ideas, Jim
creator: jim379

title: Inconsistent, grayed out toolbar, whether safe mode or not
content:

The only way to enable these buttons is to click away from an email or folder, and then return to that item, causing the buttons to be enabled again. Please refer to the screen shot for TB version number, toolbar area , and OS info.

Thanks ahead of time for any guidance or suggestions.

title: My IMAP sent email is not syncing between different computers
content:
I read through the questions like this, some identical, that have already been answered. I did the steps, selecting subscribe on the sent folder on the computer with missing sent mail, clicked download and I did not get the missing sent message that was sent on another computer yesterday. I do have all my incoming mail for the account. This is a gmail account, windows 10 and 11.

So I guess I have no idea what's wrong. I think the sent message should be on the gmail server since it went through there. I just looked, it is. And on the gmail webmail it is marked INBOX, a gray square. I looked at the incoming mail in inbox that I had replied to and there it is. This is on the gmail webmail. But in thunderbird, the reply is not appended. And it's not in sent on a synced system. Something Google decided to do with their webmail that is not supported by Thunderbird?
creator: steve.waechter
